snippet: The government is scrutinizing the finances of 15,000 Greeks to see if they have stashed money abroad — about $5 billion in all over the last three years — to avoid paying taxes.
abstract: Greek government is scrutinizing finances of about 15,000 citizens to discern whether they have stashed money abroad to avoid paying taxes; investigations are aimed at quelling public anger over austerity measures and failure of past finance ministers to investigate list of 2,000 suspected tax dodgers.
lead_paragraph: The government is scrutinizing the finances of 15,000 Greeks to see if they have stashed money abroad — about $5 billion in all over the last three years — to avoid paying taxes.

headline.main: In Greece, Taking Aim At Wealthy Tax Dodgers
headline.print_headline: In Greece, Taking Aim At Wealthy Tax Dodgers
